intro: Gypsophila saligna, commonly known as the sweet pea flower or silkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched inflorescences composed of numerous small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gypsophila saligna is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
